title: Israel Strikes Houthi-Controlled Port, Power Plants In Yemen
content: The Israeli military said on Sunday it was striking several Houthi rebel targets in Yemen, including power stations and a seaport, using dozens of aircraft.
summary: The Israeli military said on Sunday it was striking several Houthi rebel targets in Yemen, including power stations and a seaport, using dozens of aircraft.

title: Israel Used American-Made Bomb In Attack On Hezbollah Chief: US Senator
content: The bomb that Israel used to kill Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah in Beirut last week was an American-made guided weapon, a US senator said on Sunday.
summary: The bomb that Israel used to kill Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah in Beirut last week was an American-made guided weapon, a US senator said on Sunday.

title: 8 Soldiers Killed In Colombia Military Helicopter Crash
content: Eight Colombian soldiers died when the helicopter transporting them on a humanitarian mission crashed near the border with Venezuela, the country's president said Sunday.
summary: Eight Colombian soldiers died when the helicopter transporting them on a humanitarian mission crashed near the border with Venezuela, the country's president said Sunday.

title: Iran's Serious Dilemma After Hezbollah Chief Hassan Nasrallah's Killing
content: Israel's killing of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah has given Iran a serious dilemma -- how to cope with the loss of a crucial ally and still maintain its regional influence.
summary: Israel's killing of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah has given Iran a serious dilemma -- how to cope with the loss of a crucial ally and still maintain its regional influence.

title: Cash-Strapped Pak Cuts Jobs, Dissolves 6 Ministries As Part Of IMF Deal
content: In an effort to minimise administrative expenditures, cash-strapped Pakistan on Sunday announced to abolish about 150,000 government posts, close six ministries, and merge two others, as part of reforms agreed upon with the IMF under USD 7 billion lo
summary: In an effort to minimise administrative expenditures, cash-strapped Pakistan on Sunday announced to abolish about 150,000 government posts, close six ministries, and merge two others, as part of reforms agreed upon with the IMF under USD 7 billion lo

title: Taiwan On Alert Over "Multiple Waves" Of Missile Firing In Inland China
content: Taiwan's Defence Ministry said on Sunday it was on alert after detecting "multiple waves" of missile firing deep in inland China.
summary: Taiwan's Defence Ministry said on Sunday it was on alert after detecting "multiple waves" of missile firing deep in inland China.

title: Focus On UK Visas For Indians As Tory Leadership Contest Enters Last Leg
content: The two frontrunners in the race to replace Rishi Sunak as Conservative Party leader have thrown the spotlight on cutting immigration into the UK, with visas for Indians being singled out in heated debates.
summary: The two frontrunners in the race to replace Rishi Sunak as Conservative Party leader have thrown the spotlight on cutting immigration into the UK, with visas for Indians being singled out in heated debates.

title: Israel Again Strikes Hezbollah's Beirut Stronghold
content: The Israeli military said it was carrying out fresh strikes Sunday targeting Hezbollah's weapons storage facilities and infrastructure sites in Lebanon.
summary: The Israeli military said it was carrying out fresh strikes Sunday targeting Hezbollah's weapons storage facilities and infrastructure sites in Lebanon.

title: Israel's Killing Of Military Unit General "Will Not Go Unanswered": Iran
content: Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said Sunday that the death of a senior Iranian general, killed alongside Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah in an Israeli strike on Beirut, "will not go unanswered".
summary: Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said Sunday that the death of a senior Iranian general, killed alongside Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah in an Israeli strike on Beirut, "will not go unanswered".

title: Body of Hezbollah Chief Recovered From Site Of Israeli Air Attack: Report
content: The body of Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah has been recovered from the site of an Israeli air attack on Beirut's southern suburbs and is intact, a medical source and a security source told Reuters on Sunday.
summary: The body of Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah has been recovered from the site of an Israeli air attack on Beirut's southern suburbs and is intact, a medical source and a security source told Reuters on Sunday.

title: Lebanon Urges Citizens To Unite After Israel's Killing of Hassan Nasrallah
content: Lebanon's army on Sunday warned Lebanese against actions that would disturb public order in the crisis-hit country after Israel's killing of Hassan Nasrallah, leader of the powerful Iran-backed group Hezbollah.
summary: Lebanon's army on Sunday warned Lebanese against actions that would disturb public order in the crisis-hit country after Israel's killing of Hassan Nasrallah, leader of the powerful Iran-backed group Hezbollah.

title: Lebanon May Be Seeing "Largest Displacement" Ever, Says PM Najib Mikati
content: Intense Israeli attacks may have forced up to a million people to flee parts of Lebanon in possibly the worst displacement crisis in the tiny country's history, Prime Minister Najib Mikati said Sunday.
summary: Intense Israeli attacks may have forced up to a million people to flee parts of Lebanon in possibly the worst displacement crisis in the tiny country's history, Prime Minister Najib Mikati said Sunday.

title: Top Hezbollah Official Killed In Air Strike On Lebanon, Says Israeli Army
content: The Israeli military said on Sunday it had killed a senior Hezbollah official in an air strike on a Beirut suburb the day before, as it continued to target the Lebanese armed group.
summary: The Israeli military said on Sunday it had killed a senior Hezbollah official in an air strike on a Beirut suburb the day before, as it continued to target the Lebanese armed group.

title: Greece's Princess Theodora Marries US Lawyer In Lavish Royal Wedding
content: Matthew Kumar, an LA-based lawyer, proposed to Princess Theodora in 2018, but their special day was delayed twice due to unforeseen circumstances.
summary: Matthew Kumar, an LA-based lawyer, proposed to Princess Theodora in 2018, but their special day was delayed twice due to unforeseen circumstances.

title: Turkish Influencer, 26, Who Went Viral For Marrying Herself Dies By Suicide
content: In the days leading up to her death, many fans noted that Aykuts final posts on social media seemed increasingly concerning.
summary: In the days leading up to her death, many fans noted that Aykuts final posts on social media seemed increasingly concerning.

title: Space X To Bring Back Sunita Williams On Way To International Space Station
content: The NASA-SpaceX spacecraft, carrying Crew-9 members NASA astronaut Nick Hague (commander) and Roscosmos cosmonaut Aleksandr Gorbunov (mission specialist), was on its way to the International Space Station (ISS) on Sunday
summary: The NASA-SpaceX spacecraft, carrying Crew-9 members NASA astronaut Nick Hague (commander) and Roscosmos cosmonaut Aleksandr Gorbunov (mission specialist), was on its way to the International Space Station (ISS) on Sunday

title: How Israel Killed Hezbollah Chief Hassan Nasrallah In Beirut Bunker
content: Hezbollah's leader Hassan Nasrallah was killed on Saturday in an Israeli airstrike targeting an underground bunker in Beirut.
summary: Hezbollah's leader Hassan Nasrallah was killed on Saturday in an Israeli airstrike targeting an underground bunker in Beirut.

title: Iran Spy Told Israel Hezbollah Chief's Location Before Airstrike: Report
content: Hours before Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an airstrike in Lebanon's Beirut, an Iranian mole informed Israeli authorities of his location, French newspaper Le Parisien has reported.
summary: Hours before Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an airstrike in Lebanon's Beirut, an Iranian mole informed Israeli authorities of his location, French newspaper Le Parisien has reported.

title: Mystery Of 3,000-Year-Old Battle Unfolds In Germany's Tollense River Valley
content: A mystery dating back over three millennia is being unravelled in the Tollense River Valley of northeast Germany.
summary: A mystery dating back over three millennia is being unravelled in the Tollense River Valley of northeast Germany.

title: "Most Difficult Decision": Thai Farmer Forced To Kill Over 100 Crocodiles
content: A farmer in northern Thailand was forced to cull more than 100 crocodiles from his farm as heavy floods raised fears that they could escape and pose a threat to human lives.
summary: A farmer in northern Thailand was forced to cull more than 100 crocodiles from his farm as heavy floods raised fears that they could escape and pose a threat to human lives.
